p: For water extracts, L. mollissima and S. africana exhibited moderate antiplasmodial activity while S. pinnata, Z. chalybeum, T. diversifolia (leaves), and C. edulis exhibited low antiplasmodial activity. The rest of the aqueous extracts, i.e., T. brownii, E. abyssinica, T. diversifolia (flowers), and S. didymobotrya (pods and leaves) extracts, were inactive ( Table 3). For methanol extracts, S. pinnata and L. mollissima exhibited moderate antiplasmodial activity while T. brownii, Z . chalybeum, T. diversifolia (leaves), C. edulis, and S. africana exhibited low antiplasmodial activity. The rest of the methanol extracts, i.e., E. abyssinica, T. diversifolia (flowers), and S. didymobotrya (pods and leaves) extracts, were inactive.
